The soil is too wet. In the long run, the roots might rot. Please adjust the watering schedule and ensure proper drainage.
The soil is too dry. Your plant is thirsty and may start wilting. Increase the frequency of watering and ensure proper moisture.
The temperature is too high for your plant. Move it to a cooler spot and provide shade if possible to prevent heat stress.
The plant is getting cold. Find a warmer location for your plant and consider using a plant cover or insulating material to protect it from the cold.
The environment is excessively humid. Improve air circulation and avoid overwatering to prevent fungal diseases.
The air is too dry for your plant. Increase humidity by misting the leaves, using a humidifier, or placing a water tray nearby.
Your plant is receiving intense sunlight. Move it to a spot with indirect or filtered light to prevent leaf scorching.
Your plant requires more sunlight. Place it near a bright window or consider using artificial grow lights to provide adequate light.
The water tank is overfilled. Drain the excess water to avoid waterlogging and potential root rot.
Please fill the water tank so your plant can continue to receive the necessary water for optimal growth and functioning.
